meanings.sent1: She quickly and reflexly pulled her hand away from the hot stove.
meanings.sent2: He blinked reflexly when the bright light suddenly flashed.
meanings.sent3: The cat reflexly jumped at the sudden sound of thunder.
meanings.sent4: The flowers reflexly turned towards the sunlight streaming through the window.
meanings.sent5: The child reflexly closed his eyes when the wind blew sand into his face.

meanings.definition: Involving or relating to a reflex
meanings.sent1: The reflexly triggered response was immediate and automatic.
meanings.sent2: Her reflexly controlled movements impressed the coach.
meanings.sent3: The reflexly activated alarm system startled the unsuspecting burglar.
meanings.sent4: His reflexly defensive posture showed years of martial arts training.
meanings.sent5: The reflexly twitching dog's tail wagged happily as its owner approached.

meanings.sent1: She reflexly apologized even though she knew she did nothing wrong.
meanings.sent2: He reflexly reached for his phone when it rang in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent3: The student reflexly raised his hand to answer the teacher's question.
meanings.sent4: The driver reflexly slammed on the brakes when the car in front suddenly stopped.
meanings.sent5: The chef reflexly added a pinch of salt to the dish without tasting it first.
